labels.analysis: The MCP Server described is focused on enabling interaction with the OnSecurity API to retrieve and analyze security assessment data. Its core functionality revolves around querying pentest rounds, findings, and notifications, then presenting this data in an easier-to-understand format. This facilitates streamlined security review processes by automating data retrieval and analysis through conversational queries.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality aligns strongly with Security & Authentication due to its focus on security assessment data and notifications. Additionally, it involves Data Analysis & Processing since it processes raw data into understandable summaries. The tools provided suggest that is primarily used for security-related information retrieval and presentation, hence the primary label.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: OnSecurity Connector
server_info_crawled.author: @onsecurity/mcp-onsecurity
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable Claude to interact with OnSecurity API to query pentest rounds, findings, and notifications. Gain insights and summaries of your security assessments directly through conversational queries. Streamline your security review process with automated data retrieval and analysis.

tools.name: get-rounds
tools.description: Deploy Server OnSecurity Connector @onsecurity/mcp-onsecurity Try in Playground

tools.name: get-findings
tools.description: Get all findings data from OnSecurity from client in a high level summary, only include the summary, not the raw data and be sure to present the data in a way that is easy to understand for the client. You can optionally filter findings by round_id.

tools.name: get-notifications
tools.description: Get all notifications data from OnSecurity from client in a high level summary, only include the summary, not the raw data and be sure to present the data in a way that is easy to understand for the client.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@onsecurity/mcp-onsecurity/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
